refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: A segmentedlist consists of a set of headings (segtitles) and a list of parallel sets of elements. Every seglistitem contains a set of elements that have a one-to-one correspondence with the headings. Each of these elements is contained in a seg.

Segmented lists can be formatted in a number of ways. Two popular formats are tabular and as a list of repeated headings and elements. In a tabular presentation, the segmentedlist is the table. In the list presentation, the segmentedlist surrounds the entire list of blocks of heading/element pairs.

Specifying the output format for lists is not part of the normative definition of DocBook. However, the tabular and list formats are supported in the open source DocBook stylesheets using the list-presentation attribute on the dbhtml and dbfo processing instructions. The examples on this reference page show how to use these processing instructions. processing instructions
